messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Re: Musashi by Eiji Yoshikawa
messages.msgSnippet: I think you are refering to the trilogy of films produced in the 1950s, starring Toshiro Mifune. Musashi has been the subject of numerous movie and TV
messages.messageBody:
I think you are refering to the trilogy of films produced in the 1950s,
starring Toshiro Mifune. Musashi has been the subject of numerous movie and
TV productions, also notable is the 5 film series starring Yoruzawa
Kinnosuke. Next years NHK Taiga drama will be Musashi spurned on by the
success of the Vagabond Manga series.
----- Original Message -----
From: squrpio_prince <squrpio_prince@...>
To: <samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, July 25, 2002 5:47 AM
Subject: [samuraihistory] Re: Musashi by Eiji Yoshikawa


> Greetings JJ,
>
>
>
> I have read the book of The Five Rings and I thought it interesting.
> His style and ingenuity is genious. If you like Musashi he has 3
> movies that are kind of old called Musashi. I have only seen the last
> one and I thought it was great
>
>

messages.subject: Re: Musashi by Eiji Yoshikawa
messages.msgSnippet: Greetings JJ, I have read the book of The Five Rings and I thought it interesting. His style and ingenuity is genious. If you like Musashi he has 3 movies that
messages.messageBody:
Greetings JJ,



I have read the book of The Five Rings and I thought it interesting.
His style and ingenuity is genious. If you like Musashi he has 3
movies that are kind of old called Musashi. I have only seen the last
one and I thought it was great
